metadata.title: Rental Yield Calculator (Gross, Net, Cash-on-Cash, Cap Rate)
metadata.description: Multi-method rental yield calculator supporting gross yield, net yield, cap rate and cash-on-cash return. Includes vacancy adjustment, operating expenses and financing impact. Provides clear formulas, caveats and standards references for accuracy and compliance.

gross_yield.label: Gross Yield
gross_yield.description: Simple yield based on effective rental income before operating expenses and financing.

net_yield.label: Net Yield
net_yield.description: Yield after operating expenses (also called net operating income yield).

cash_on_cash.label: Cash-on-Cash Return
cash_on_cash.description: Measures the pre-tax cash return on the actual cash invested (down payment and upfront costs). Accounts for financing payments.

cap_rate.label: Capitalization Rate (Cap Rate)
cap_rate.description: Cap rate = NOI divided by property value. Used as a valuation and comparison metric.

fields.label: Property purchase price / current market value
Annual operating expenses (taxes, insurance, maintenance, management)
Total cash invested up front (down payment + upfront costs)

introduction: This calculator helps investors estimate rental performance using several common metrics: gross yield, net yield (NOI / value), cap rate, and cash-on-cash return. It adjusts rental income for vacancy and lets you include operating expenses and annual mortgage payments to show financing impact.

Use the tool for preliminary screening and comparison. Results are estimates intended to inform decisions; they are not financial advice. Always verify inputs and consult a qualified accountant, tax advisor or local regulator before acting.
methodology: We compute an effective annual rent by applying the vacancy rate to gross rent. Net operating income (NOI) equals effective rent minus annual operating expenses. Gross yield is effective rent divided by property value. Net yield and cap rate use NOI divided by property value. Cash-on-cash divides annual pre-tax cash flow by cash invested.

Formulas and internal checks follow good data integrity and calculation practices. We reference industry and engineering standards for reliability and auditability, and include explicit caveats about rounding, local rules and tax treatment.
how_is_calculated: Cash-on-cash (%) = (annual_cash_flow ÷ down_payment) × 100 where annual_cash_flow = NOI − mortgage_annual_payment

faqs.question: Which metric should I use for quick screening?
faqs.answer: Gross yield is quick for initial screening because it requires only rent and price. For a more realistic comparison, use net yield or cap rate, which account for operating costs. If financing matters, use cash-on-cash return to measure return on invested cash.

faqs.question: Does this calculator include tax, depreciation or capital gains?
faqs.answer: No. The calculator provides pre-tax operating metrics. Taxes, depreciation, capital gains treatment and local rules vary and materially affect returns. Consult a tax professional for after-tax analysis.

faqs.question: How accurate are the results?
faqs.answer: Results are arithmetic estimates based on the inputs you provide. Expect rounding differences and sensitivity to inputs like vacancy and expenses. We recommend sensitivity checks and validating outputs against signed contracts or professional valuations.

faqs.question: Are financing costs always included?
faqs.answer: Financing is included only where you provide annual mortgage payments and down payment. Metrics like cap rate and net yield are typically shown on an unlevered (no debt) basis; cash-on-cash explicitly includes leverage.

faqs.question: Can I rely on this for compliance or safety assessments?
faqs.answer: No. This tool is for financial estimation only. For regulatory compliance, occupational safety, building codes, or structural assessments consult licensed professionals and authorities.

citations.label: NIST - Frameworks and Guidance on Data Integrity and Measurement
ISO - Standards Catalogue (financial and measurement standards)
IEEE - Recommended practices for numerical software quality
OSHA - Guidance for workplace safety and compliance (for property managers)

glossary.definition: Annual rent divided by property purchase price or value, expressed as a percentage. Does not account for operating expenses or financing.
Net operating income (NOI) divided by property value, expressed as a percentage. Accounts for operating expenses but not financing or taxes.
Effective rental income after vacancy minus operating expenses. Does not include financing costs or taxes.
Short for capitalization rate; NOI divided by property value. Used to compare returns across properties.
Annual pre-tax cash flow divided by the actual cash invested (down payment and upfront costs), expressed as a percentage. Reflects leverage impact.
Estimated percentage of time the property will be unoccupied, used to reduce gross rent to effective rent.
